info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 4 at 2:55PM EDT until May 4 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains due to slow training thunderstorms. Rainfall amounts of 1 and 3 inches have already fallen during the last couple of hours from these slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours with the slow moving thunderstorms. if the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Homestead, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, West Perrine, Richmond Heights, Zoo Miami, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay, Goulds, Richmond West, The Crossings, Country Walk, West Kendall, Princeton, Sunset and The Hammocks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING
